intro: Bidens andicola, commonly known as the Andean ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers consist of yellow disk florets surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. Bidens andicola is adapted to cold and arid conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
